verses.kjv: Woe to the bloody city! it is all full of lies and robbery; the prey departeth not;
verses.ct: Disaster is coming to the city of bloodshed! It is completely filled with lies and stolen goods; the victims never stop piling up.

verses.kjv: The noise of a whip, and the noise of the rattling of the wheels, and of the pransing horses, and of the jumping chariots.
verses.ct: Listen — the crack of whips, the rumble of wheels, galloping horses, and bouncing chariots!

verses.kjv: The horseman lifteth up both the bright sword and the glittering spear: and there is a multitude of slain, and a great number of carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumble upon their corpses:
verses.ct: Cavalry charges forward with flashing swords and gleaming spears! The dead are everywhere — massive heaps of bodies, corpses without end. People trip over the fallen.

verses.kjv: Because of the multitude of the whoredoms of the wellfavoured harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations through her whoredoms, and families through her witchcrafts.
verses.ct: All of this because of the endless prostitution of the beautiful seductress, the expert in sorcery, who enslaved nations through her seductions and peoples through her dark arts.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against thee, saith the LORD of hosts; and I will discover thy skirts upon thy face, and I will shew the nations thy nakedness, and the kingdoms thy shame.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am against you," declares the LORD of hosts. "I will lift your skirts over your head, and I will expose your nakedness to the nations and your disgrace to the kingdoms."

verses.kjv: And I will cast abominable filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazingstock.
verses.ct: "I will throw disgusting filth on you and treat you with contempt, and I will make you a public spectacle."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee shall flee from thee, and say, Nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her? whence shall I seek comforters for thee?
verses.ct: Then everyone who sees you will run from you and say, 'Nineveh is destroyed! Who will mourn for her? Where would I even find anyone to comfort you?'

verses.kjv: Art thou better than populous No, that was situate among the rivers, that had the waters round about it, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall was from the sea?
verses.ct: Are you any better than Thebes, which sat among the river channels, surrounded by water, with the Nile as her defense and the waters as her wall?

verses.kjv: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and it was infinite; Put and Lubim were thy helpers.
verses.ct: Ethiopia and Egypt gave her limitless strength; Put and Libya were her allies.

verses.kjv: Yet was she carried away, she went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the top of all the streets: and they cast lots for her honourable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.
verses.ct: Yet even she was taken away and dragged into exile. Her infants were smashed to pieces at every street corner. Her leaders were divided up by casting lots, and all her important men were bound in chains.

verses.kjv: Thou also shalt be drunken: thou shalt be hid, thou also shalt seek strength because of the enemy.
verses.ct: You too will become drunk with defeat. You will go into hiding, and you will search desperately for refuge from the enemy.

verses.kjv: All thy strong holds shall be like fig trees with the firstripe figs: if they be shaken, they shall even fall into the mouth of the eater.
verses.ct: All your fortresses are like fig trees with ripe fruit — when shaken, the figs drop right into the mouth of whoever eats them.

verses.kjv: Behold, thy people in the midst of thee are women: the gates of thy land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire shall devour thy bars.
verses.ct: Look at your troops — they are as weak as untrained civilians! The gates of your land stand wide open to your enemies, and fire has consumed the bars that held them shut.

verses.kjv: Draw thee waters for the siege, fortify thy strong holds: go into clay, and tread the morter, make strong the brickkiln.
verses.ct: Store up water for the siege! Strengthen your fortifications! Get into the clay pits, stomp the mortar, and mold the bricks!

verses.kjv: There shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off, it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself many as the cankerworm, make thyself many as the locusts.
verses.ct: But even there, fire will consume you and the sword will cut you down. It will devour you like swarming locusts. Go ahead — multiply yourselves like locusts, swarm like grasshoppers!

verses.kjv: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven: the cankerworm spoileth, and fleeth away.
verses.ct: You increased your merchants until they outnumbered the stars in the heavens — but like locusts, they strip everything bare and then fly away.

verses.kjv: Thy crowned are as the locusts, and thy captains as the great grasshoppers, which camp in the hedges in the cold day, but when the sun ariseth they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
verses.ct: Your officials are like locusts, and your commanders are like swarms of grasshoppers that settle on the walls during a cold day. But when the sun comes out, they fly off, and no one knows where they went.

verses.kjv: Thy shepherds slumber, O king of Assyria: thy nobles shall dwell in the dust: thy people is scattered upon the mountains, and no man gathereth them.
verses.ct: Your leaders are asleep, king of Assyria. Your nobles lie dead in the dust. Your people are scattered across the mountains, and no one gathers them together.

verses.kjv: There is no healing of thy bruise; thy wound is grievous: all that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hands over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness passed continually?
verses.ct: There is no remedy for your wound; your injury is fatal. Everyone who hears the news about you will clap their hands in celebration, because who has not suffered under your constant cruelty?
